definition: to approach one's coffin (idiom); with one foot in the grave

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])

at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning
tree/wood/coffin/wooden/simple/numb/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: Thousands of people streamed past the now moribund check points.
sentences.chinese: 数千德国人涌到行将就木的检查站。

sentences.english: The government of Ernesto Zedillo knew that the food subsidy programs would do little to help.
sentences.chinese: 萨迪略政府知道之前的食物补贴制度已经行将就木。

sentences.english: Is the old faithful axe on its last leg?
sentences.chinese: 你那柄忠实的旧斧头已经行将就木了么？

definition: one's late days/to have one foot in the grave
lit. the disease has attacked the vitals (idiom); fig. beyond cure/the situation is hopeless
to have only a breath of life (idiom)
final radiance of setting sun/fig. dying flash (of lucidity or activity, prior to demise)
